meanings.sent1: The chef was blunting the knife to make it safer to use.
meanings.sent2: The pencil tip was blunting after writing for a long time.
meanings.sent3: She tried blunting the scissors by cutting through tough cardboard.
meanings.sent4: The blunting of his memory made it hard to recall details from the past.
meanings.sent5: The blunting of the blade made it difficult to slice through the tough meat.

meanings.sent1: The medication was blunting the pain in his arm.
meanings.sent2: The blunting of the colors in the painting gave it a softer look.
meanings.sent3: His blunting of the music volume annoyed his neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The blunting of her enthusiasm for the project was noticeable.
meanings.sent5: The blunting of the sunlight through the clouds created a gentle glow.

meanings.definition: Dull or reduce the intensity of.
meanings.sent1: The rain was blunting the sound of the traffic outside.
meanings.sent2: The blunting of the flavors in the dish made it less enjoyable.
meanings.sent3: His blunting of the TV volume made it hard to hear the dialogue.
meanings.sent4: The blunting of her emotions made her seem distant.
meanings.sent5: The blunting of the colors in the photograph gave it a vintage look.
